1.verse: I wrote the first book, Theophilus, about everything that Jesus began to do and to teach,

2.verse: until the day when, having given commands through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen, he was taken up;

3.verse: to whom also he presented himself alive after his passion by many proofs, being seen by them over a period of forty days and telling them what concerns the kingdom of God.

4.verse: While he was with them, he ordered them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to await the promise of the Father, which, he said, “you heard from me;

5.verse: for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”

6.verse: So when they had come together, they asked him, saying, “Lord, is this the time when you will restore the kingdom to Israel?”

7.verse: But he said to them, “It is not for you to know the times or seasons that the Father has set by his own authority.

8.verse: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses both in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.”

9.verse: And when he had said these words, while they were watching, he was lifted up and a cloud took him away from their eyes.

10.verse: And while they were gazing into the sky, as he was going, behold, two men stood by them in white robes,

11.verse: and said, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking up into the sky? This Jesus, who was taken up from you into heaven, will come in the same way as you saw him going into heaven.”

12.verse: Then they returned to Jerusalem from a hill called “The Mount of Olives,” which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s walk away.

13.verse: And when they had entered the city, they went up to the upper room, where they were lodging; Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot and Judas the son of James.

14.verse: These all were devoting themselves with a single purpose to prayer, with the women and Mary, the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

15.verse: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the brothers (a crowd of people, about a hundred and twenty, had gathered together), and said,

16.verse: “My brothers, it was necessary for the Scripture to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became guide to those who arrested Jesus.

17.verse: For he was numbered among us and received his allotted share of this ministry.”

18.verse: (Now this man bought a field with the reward of his unjust deed, and falling headfirst he burst open in the middle and all his intestines gushed out.

19.verse: And it became known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the field was called in their own language Akeldama, that is, “Field of Blood.”)

20.verse: “For it is written in the Book of Psalms, ‘Let his house become deserted, and let there be no one living in it’; and ‘Let another take over his responsibilities.’

21.verse: It is necessary, therefore, that of the men who have accompanied us during all the time in which the Lord Jesus came in and went out among us,

22.verse: beginning from the baptism of John until the day on which he was taken up from us—that one of these become with us a witness of his resurrection.”

23.verse: So they proposed two, Joseph called Barsabbas (who was called Justus), and Matthias.

24.verse: And they prayed and said, “You, Lord, the one who knows the hearts of all, show which one of these two you have chosen

25.verse: to take the place of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas turned aside to go to his own place.”

26.verse: And they cast lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was counted with the eleven apostles.

1.verse: When the day of Pentecost arrived, they were all together in the same place.

2.verse: And suddenly from heaven there came a sound like a violent blast of wind, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.

3.verse: And there appeared to them tongues spreading out like fire, and one came to rest on each one of them.

4.verse: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they began to speak with other tongues as the Spirit gave them utterance.

5.verse: Now there were living in Jerusalem Jews, devout men from every nation under heaven.

6.verse: But when this sound was heard the crowd gathered, and they were perplexed, because each one was hearing them speak in his own language.

7.verse: And they were amazed and wondered, saying, “Are not all these who are speaking Galileans?

8.verse: And how do we hear, each of us in his own language to which he was born?

9.verse: Parthians and Medes and Elamites and residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

10.verse: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene, and visitors from Rome,

11.verse: Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabians—we hear them telling in our own tongues the mighty works of God.”

12.verse: And all were amazed and perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”

13.verse: But others mocking said, “They are filled with new wine.”

14.verse: But Peter, taking his stand with the eleven, lifted up his voice and addressed them, “Men of Judea and all you who live in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and give ear to my words.

15.verse: For these men are not, as you suppose, drunk, since it is only the third hour of the day.

16.verse: But this is what was spoken of through the prophet Joel:

17.verse: ‘And it will be in the last days,’ declares God, ‘that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh, and your sons and your daughters will prophesy, and your young men will see visions, and your old men will dream dreams.

18.verse: Even on my male servants and on my female servants in those days I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.

19.verse: And I will show wonders in the heavens above and signs on the earth below, blood, and fire, and smoky vapor.

20.verse: The sun will be turned into darkness and the moon into blood, before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.

21.verse: And it shall be that everyone who calls upon the name of the Lord will be saved.’

22.verse: “Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a man attested to you by God with mighty works and wonders and signs that God did through him in your midst, as you yourselves know—

23.verse: this Jesus, delivered up according to the determined purpose and foreknowledge of God, you, at the hands of those outside the law, executed by nailing him to a cross;

24.verse: whom God raised up, loosing the pangs of death, as it was not possible for him to be held by it.

25.verse: For David says regarding him, ‘I foresaw the Lord before me always, for he is at my right hand that I may not be shaken;

26.verse: on account of this my heart rejoiced, and my tongue was glad; moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope.

27.verse: For you will not abandon my soul to Hades, or allow your Holy One to see corruption.

28.verse: You have made known to me the paths of life; you will make me full of joy with your presence.’

29.verse: My brothers, I can speak to you confidently about the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried and his tomb is with us to this day.

30.verse: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God promised him with an oath that he would place one of his descendants on his throne,

31.verse: he foresaw and spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that he was not abandoned to Hades, nor did his flesh see corruption.

32.verse: This Jesus God raised up, of which we all are witnesses.

33.verse: So then, exalted at the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this that you are both seeing and hearing.

34.verse: For David did not ascend into the heavens, but he himself says, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,

35.verse: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.’

36.verse: So let the entire house of Israel know for certain that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”

37.verse: Now when they heard this they were cut to the heart, and they said to Peter and the other apostles, “My brothers, what shall we do?”

38.verse: And Peter said to them, “Repent and let every one of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

39.verse: For the promise is for you and for your children and for all who are far away—as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.”

40.verse: And with many other words he gave them warning and pleaded with them, saying, “Escape from this corrupt generation.”

41.verse: So those who received his word were baptized, and there were added on that day about three thousand souls.

42.verse: And they were devoting themselves to the teaching of the apostles, to the fellowship, to the breaking of bread, and to prayers.

43.verse: Fear came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.

44.verse: And all who believed were together, and had all things in common;

45.verse: and they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as anyone had need.

46.verse: And every day, they continued to gather together in the temple, breaking bread from house to house, sharing their food with joy and simplicity of heart,

47.verse: praising God, and finding favor with all the people. And the Lord was adding to their number day by day those who were being saved.

1.verse: Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

2.verse: And a man lame from the womb of his mother was being carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple called the “Beautiful Gate” to ask alms from those entering into the temple.

3.verse: When he saw Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive alms.

4.verse: But Peter, looking directly at him, as did John, said, “Look at us.”

5.verse: So the lame man gave them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.

6.verse: But Peter said, “Silver and gold is not possessed by me, but what I do have I give to you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, stand up and walk!”

7.verse: Then taking him by the right hand, Peter raised him up, and immediately his feet and ankles were made strong;

8.verse: and jumping up, he stood and began to walk and entered with them into the temple, walking and jumping and praising God.

9.verse: And all the people saw him walking and praising God,

10.verse: and recognized him—that he was the one who used to sit and ask for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. And they were filled with awe and amazement at what had happened to him.

11.verse: While he clung to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the covered walkway called Solomon’s Portico, utterly astounded.

12.verse: When Peter saw this, he replied to the people, “Men of Israel, why are you amazed at this, or why do you stare at us, as though by our own power or piety we had made him walk?

13.verse: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—the God of our fathers—glorified his servant Jesus, whom you delivered over and disowned in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release him.

14.verse: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked that a man who was a murderer be released to you,

15.verse: and you killed the Originator of life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.

16.verse: And on the basis of faith in his name—his name itself has made this man strong, whom you see and know. The faith that is through Jesus has given him this wholeness before all of you.

17.verse: And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did your rulers as well.

18.verse: But the things God foretold through the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ would suffer, he has fulfilled in this way.

19.verse: Repent therefore, and turn again, for the blotting out of your sins,

20.verse: that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord, and that he may send the Messiah appointed for you, that is, Jesus,

21.verse: whom heaven must receive until the time of restoration of all things, which God spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets long ago.

22.verse: Moses said, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet from among your brothers, as he raised me. You must obey him in all things whatsoever he speaks to you.

23.verse: And it will be that every soul who does not obey that prophet will be destroyed from among the people.’

24.verse: And all the prophets from Samuel and those who came after him, as many as have spoken, also announced these days.

25.verse: You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God made with your fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your offspring shall all the families of the earth be blessed.’

26.verse: God, having raised up his servant, sent him to you first, to bless you by turning each one of you from your wicked ways.”

1.verse: And as they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees moved in on them,

2.verse: greatly annoyed because they were teaching the people and announcing in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

3.verse: So they laid hands on them and put them in custody until the next day, since it was already evening.

4.verse: And many of those who had heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to about five thousand.

5.verse: On the next day their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem,

6.verse: both Annas the high priest and Caiaphas and John and Alexander, and as many as were of the high-priestly family.

7.verse: And having set them in the midst, they began to inquire, “By what power or by what name did you do this?”

8.verse: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders,

9.verse: if we are being examined today about a good deed done to a sick man, by what means this man has been healed,

10.verse: let it be known to you all and to all the people of Israel that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by him this man is standing before you healthy.

11.verse: This is the stone that was rejected by you, the builders, that has become the chief cornerstone.

12.verse: And salvation is in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”

13.verse: Seeing the boldness of Peter and John, and coming to find that they were uneducated and common men, they were astonished and recognized that they had been with Jesus.

14.verse: But seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to say in opposition.

15.verse: But commanding them to go outside the council, they discussed the matter with one another,

16.verse: saying, “What shall we do with these men? For that a notable sign has been done through them is evident to all who live in Jerusalem, and we are unable to deny it.

17.verse: But that it may spread no further among the people, let us warn them no longer to speak in this name to anyone among men.”

18.verse: So they called them and ordered them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.

19.verse: But Peter and John said in answer to them, “Whether it is right before God to obey you rather than God, you must judge,

20.verse: for we cannot help speaking of the things we have seen and heard.”

21.verse: And when they had threatened them further, they let them go, for they could not find how to punish them on account of the people, since they all were praising God for what had happened.

22.verse: For the man was over forty years old on whom this sign of healing had been performed.

23.verse: After they were released, they went to their friends and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

24.verse: When they heard this, they lifted their voices together to God and said, “Sovereign Lord, you who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and everything that is in them,

25.verse: who through the mouth of our father David, your servant, by the Holy Spirit did say, ‘Why did the Gentiles rage, and the peoples devise vain schemes?

26.verse: The kings of the earth took their stand, and the rulers gathered together against the Lord and against his Messiah.’

27.verse: For truly there were gathered together in this city against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, along with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel,

28.verse: to do whatever your hand and your plan had predetermined to be.

29.verse: And now, Lord, look upon their threats and grant to your servants with all boldness to speak your word,

30.verse: while you stretch out your hand to heal, and signs and wonders are done through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”

31.verse: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak the word of God with boldness.

32.verse: Now the whole group of those who believed were of one heart and soul, and not even one said that anything that belonged to him was his own, but everything was common property for them.

33.verse: And with great power the apostles continued to give the testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was upon them all.

34.verse: For there was not a needy person among them, for as many as were owners of land or houses sold them and brought the proceeds from what was sold

35.verse: and placed it at the apostles’ feet; and they distributed to each according as anyone had need.

36.verse: And Joseph, who was surnamed Barnabas by the apostles (when translated means, “Son of Encouragement”), a Levite, a Cypriot by race,

37.verse: sold a field that belonged to him and brought the money and placed it at the apostles’ feet.

1.verse: Now a man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a piece of property,

2.verse: and kept back for himself some of the proceeds, with his wife’s knowledge, and brought only part of it and placed it at the apostles’ feet.

3.verse: But Peter said, “Ananias, why did Satan fill your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back for yourself part of the proceeds of the field?

4.verse: While it remained unsold, did it not remain yours? And after it was sold, was it not under your control? Why is it that you have contrived this affair in your heart? You have not lied to men but to God!”

5.verse: When Ananias heard these words, he fell down and breathed his last. Great fear gripped all who heard about it.

6.verse: So the young men came forward, wrapped him up, then carried him out and buried him.

7.verse: After an interval of about three hours his wife came in, unaware of what had happened.

8.verse: And Peter addressed her, “Tell me whether for so much you sold the land” And she said, “Yes, for so much.”

9.verse: And Peter said to her, “Why is it that you agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look! The feet of those who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”

10.verse: And she fell down immediately at his feet and breathed her last. When the young men came in and found her dead, they carried her out and buried her beside her husband.

11.verse: Great fear gripped the entire church, and all who heard about these things.

12.verse: By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were being done among the people. And they were all together in Solomon’s Portico.

13.verse: But of the others no one dared to join them; however, the people held them in high regard,

14.verse: and more than ever believers were added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women,

15.verse: so that they carried out the sick even into the streets, and laid them on cots and mats, so that as Peter came by at least his shadow might fall on some of them.

16.verse: A great number of people from the towns around Jerusalem also came, bringing the sick and those tormented by evil spirits, and they were healed, all of them.

17.verse: Then the high priest stood up and all who were with him (that is, the party of the Sadducees), and they were filled with indignation,

18.verse: and they laid hands on the apostles and put them in the public jail.

19.verse: But an angel of the Lord during the night opened the doors of the prison and brought them out and said,

20.verse: “Go and stand in the temple and speak to the people all the words of this life.”

21.verse: And when they heard this, they entered the temple at daybreak and began to teach. But when the high priest came, and those who were with him, they called together the council and all the elders of the sons of Israel and they sent to the prison to have them brought before them.

22.verse: But when the officers came, they did not find them in the prison, so they returned and reported,

23.verse: saying, “We found the prison locked with every security and the guards standing at the doors, but when we opened it we found no one inside.”

24.verse: On hearing these words, both the captain of the temple and the chief priests were perplexed about them, wondering what this could be.

25.verse: And someone came and reported to them, “Look! The men whom you put in the prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people.”

26.verse: Then the captain went with the officers and brought them, but not with force, for they feared the people, lest they be stoned.

27.verse: And they brought them and had them stand before the council. The high priest questioned them,

28.verse: saying, “We gave you a strict order to stop teaching in this name. Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you intend to bring on us the blood of this man.”

29.verse: But in response, Peter and the other apostles said, “It is necessary to obey God rather than men.”

30.verse: The God of our fathers raised Jesus, whom you killed by hanging him on a tree.

31.verse: God exalted this Jesus to his own right hand as Leader and Savior, so as to provide repentance for Israel and the remission of sins.

32.verse: And we are witnesses of these events, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”

33.verse: Now when they heard this, they were enraged and wanted to kill them.

34.verse: But there stood up one in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, respected by all the people, and he ordered them to put the men outside for a short time.

35.verse: And he said to them, “Men of Israel, take heed to yourselves about these men, what you intend to do.

36.verse: For before these days there rose up Theudas, saying that he himself was someone, and a number of men, about four hundred, joined him. He was killed, and all, as many as followed him, were dispersed, and the movement came to nothing.

37.verse: After him rose up Judas the Galilean, in the days of the census and mislead people, so that they followed him. He too perished, and all, as many as followed him, were scattered.

38.verse: So in the present case I tell you, keep away from these men and leave them alone, for if this plan or this undertaking be of men, it will fail;

39.verse: but if it is of God, you will not be able to stop them; lest you be found also opposing God!” They were persuaded by him,

40.verse: so summoning the apostles, they beat them and ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and they released them.

41.verse: So then they went rejoicing from the presence of the council, because they had been considered worthy to suffer indignity on behalf of the name.

42.verse: And every day, both in the temple and at home, they did not stop teaching and preaching Jesus the Christ.

1.verse: Now in these days when the number of the disciples was increasing, there was a complaint by the Hellenists against the Hebrews because their widows were being neglected in the daily distribution of food.

2.verse: So the twelve called together the entire group of disciples and said, “It is not right for us to neglect the word of God in order to wait on tables.

3.verse: Therefore, brothers, select from among you seven men of good standing, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we will appoint to carry out this responsibility.

4.verse: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”

5.verse: And the proposal pleased the entire group, so they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit; also Philip and Prochorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch.

6.verse: These they set before the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.

7.verse: And the word of God continued to spread, and the number of disciples increased greatly in Jerusalem, and a large group of priests became obedient to the faith.

8.verse: And Stephen, full of grace and power, was doing great wonders and signs among the people.

9.verse: But there rose up some of those of the synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called), both Cyrenians and Alexandrians, as well as those from Cilicia and Asia, disputing with Stephen.

10.verse: Yet they could not withstand the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.

11.verse: Then they secretly talked some men into saying, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”

12.verse: And they incited the people and the elders and the scribes, and they suddenly moved in and seized him and brought him before the council,

13.verse: and they set up false witnesses who said, “This man does not stop saying words against this holy place and the law,

14.verse: for we have heard him say that this Jesus the Nazarene will destroy this place and will change the customs that Moses handed down to us.”

15.verse: And everyone who was sitting in the council, looking intently at him, saw his face like the face of an angel.

1.verse: And the high priest said, “Are these things true?”

2.verse: And Stephen said: “My brothers and fathers, hear me. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,

3.verse: and said to him, ‘Go out from your land and from your relatives and come to the land that I will show you.’

4.verse: Then he went out from the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. And after his father died, God had him move to this land in which you are now living.

5.verse: Yet he gave him no inheritance in it, not even a foot of ground, but promised to give it to him as a possession and to his descendants after him, though as yet Abraham had no child.

6.verse: And God spoke thus, that Abraham’s descendants would be sojourners in a foreign land, and that the people would enslave and mistreat them four hundred years.

7.verse: But, ‘Whatever nation they serve as slaves, I will punish,’ said God, ‘and after this they will come out and they will worship me in this place.’

8.verse: And he gave him a covenant of circumcision; and so Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.

9.verse: “And the patriarchs, jealous of Joseph, sold him into Egypt; but God was with him,

10.verse: and rescued him out of all his afflictions and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who appointed him ruler over Egypt and over all his royal household.

11.verse: Now there came a famine upon all Egypt and Canaan, bringing great affliction, and our fathers could find no food.

12.verse: But Jacob, hearing that there was grain in Egypt, sent our fathers out on their first visit.

13.verse: On their second visit Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and the lineage of Joseph became clear to Pharaoh.

14.verse: Then Joseph sent and summoned Jacob his father and all his relatives, seventy-five persons.

15.verse: And Jacob went down into Egypt, and he himself died there, along with our fathers,

16.verse: and they were brought back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

17.verse: “But as the time of the promise drew near, which God had granted to Abraham, our people increased and multiplied in Egypt,

18.verse: until there arose another king over Egypt who did not know Joseph.

19.verse: He took advantage of our nation and mistreated our fathers, making them expose their infants, so that they would not be kept alive.

20.verse: At which time Moses was born, and he was beautiful before God. He was brought up for three months in his father’s house;

21.verse: and when he was abandoned, the daughter of Pharaoh rescued him and brought him up for herself as a son.

22.verse: So Moses was trained in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in his words and deeds.

23.verse: “When he was about forty years old, it entered his mind to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.

24.verse: And seeing one of them being treated unjustly, he defended him and brought justice to the one being mistreated by striking down the Egyptian.

25.verse: He thought that his brothers would understand that God, by his hand, was granting them deliverance; but they did not understand.

26.verse: On the following day he appeared to them as they were quarreling and tried to reconcile them to be at peace, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why are you hurting one another?’

27.verse: But the one who was trying to injure his neighbor pushed Moses aside, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

28.verse: Do you want to kill me as yesterday you killed the Egyptian?’

29.verse: At this remark, Moses fled and became an exile in the land of Midian, where he had two sons.

30.verse: “Now when forty years had passed, there appeared to him in the desert near Mount Sinai an angel in the flame of a burning bush.

31.verse: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight; and as he came closer to look at it, there came the voice of the Lord:

32.verse: ‘I am the God of your forefathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob.’ And Moses began to tremble and did not dare to look.

33.verse: And the Lord said to him, ‘Take off the sandals from your feet, for the place on which you stand is holy ground.

34.verse: Surely I have seen the oppression of my people in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.’

35.verse: This Moses, whom they rejected, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’—this man God sent both as ruler and redeemer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

36.verse: He led them out, performing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and at the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.

37.verse: This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, ‘God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, as he raised up me.’

38.verse: He is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, and he received living oracles to give to us.

39.verse: To him our fathers were not willing to be obedient, but thrust him aside, and turned in their hearts to Egypt,

40.verse: saying to Aaron, ‘Make for us gods who will go before us, for this Moses who brought us from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.’

41.verse: And they made a calf in those days and offered a sacrifice to the idol and began rejoicing in the works of their hands.

42.verse: But God turned away and gave them over to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the prophets: ‘Did you bring to me slain beasts and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel? No;

43.verse: You took along the shrine of Moloch and the star of your god Rephan, the images that you made, to worship them, so I will make you move beyond Babylon.’

44.verse: “The tabernacle of witness was with our fathers in the wilderness just as the one who spoke to Moses ordered him to make it according to the pattern that he had seen.

45.verse: And when our fathers received it in return, they brought it in with Joshua in taking possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, until the days of David,

46.verse: who found favor in the sight of God and asked to find a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

47.verse: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.

48.verse: Yet the Most High does not dwell in houses made by hands; as the prophet says,

49.verse: ‘Heaven is my throne, and earth is the footstool for my feet. What sort of house will you build for me, says the Lord, or what is the place of my rest?

50.verse: Did not my hand make all these things?’

51.verse: “You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears! You are always resisting the Holy Spirit. As your fathers were, so also are you.

52.verse: Which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute? They killed those who announced beforehand concerning the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers!

53.verse: You, who received the law by decrees given by angels and did not keep it.”

54.verse: Now when they heard these things, they became furious and ground their teeth at him.

55.verse: But Stephen, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked right into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

56.verse: And he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”

57.verse: But they cried out with a loud voice and covered their ears and rushed together at him.

58.verse: When they had driven him out of the city, they began to stone him; and the witnesses laid their cloaks at the feet of a young man named Saul.

59.verse: They kept stoning Stephen as he was calling on God and saying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”

60.verse: And falling to his knees he cried out in a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

1.verse: Now Saul was in agreement with his execution. There arose on that day a great persecution against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.

2.verse: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.

3.verse: But Saul was making havoc of the church; entering every house, he dragged off both men and women and put them in prison.

4.verse: Now those who were scattered went from place to place preaching the word.

5.verse: Philip went down to the main city of Samaria and began proclaiming to them the Christ.

6.verse: And with one accord the crowds paid attention to what was being said by Philip as they heard him and saw the signs that he was performing.

7.verse: For many of those who had unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, came out; and many paralyzed and lame were healed.

8.verse: So there was great joy in that city.

9.verse: Now there was a man named Simon, who had been practicing magic in the city and amazing the people of Samaria, saying that he himself was someone great.

10.verse: They all paid attention to him, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is the power of God, which is called Great.”

11.verse: And they paid attention to him because for a long time he had amazed them by his magic.

12.verse: But when they believed Philip as he preached about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

13.verse: Even Simon himself believed, and after being baptized he stayed constantly with Philip. And seeing signs and great miracles happening, he was amazed.

14.verse: Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent to them Peter and John,

15.verse: who went down and prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit,

16.verse: for he had not yet fallen on any one of them, but they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

17.verse: Then Peter and John laid hands on them and they received the Holy Spirit.

18.verse: But when Simon saw that it was through the laying on of the hands of the apostles that the Spirit was given, he offered them money,

19.verse: saying, “Give me also this power, that anyone on whom I lay hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”

20.verse: But Peter said to him, “May your silver go with you to destruction, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

21.verse: There is not for you a part or share in this matter, for your heart is not upright before God.

22.verse: Repent, therefore, of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord that, if possible, the intent of your heart may be forgiven you.

23.verse: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of unrighteousness.”

24.verse: And answering, Simon said, “You pray for me to the Lord so that nothing of what you have said may come upon me.”

25.verse: Now after solemnly testifying and speaking the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.

26.verse: Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Rise and go toward the south on the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” This is a desert place.

27.verse: And he rose and went. And there was an Ethiopian, a eunuch, a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship

28.verse: and was returning, seated in his carriage, and he was reading the prophet Isaiah.

29.verse: And the Spirit said to Philip, “Go over and join this carriage.”

30.verse: So Philip ran to him and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet and he said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”

31.verse: And he said, “How could I unless someone guide me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.

32.verse: Now the passage of scripture the man was reading was this: “As a sheep to the slaughter he was led, and as a lamb dumb before its shearer, so he opens not his mouth.

33.verse: In humiliation justice was taken from him. His family history who will declare? For his life is taken away from the earth.”

34.verse: And in answer the eunuch said to Philip, “I ask you, about whom does the prophet say this, about himself or about someone else?”

35.verse: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture he announced the good news to him, Jesus.

36.verse: And as they traveled along the road they came to some water; and the eunuch said, “Look! Water! What prevents me from being baptized?”

37.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

38.verse: And he ordered the carriage to stop, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.

39.verse: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch saw him no more, but went on his way rejoicing.

40.verse: But Philip was found at Azotus; and as he traveled through the area he announced the good news to all the towns, until he came to Caesarea.

1.verse: But Saul, still breathing threat and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest

2.verse: and requested from him letters to Damascus addressed to the synagogues, that if he found any who were of the Way, men or women, he should bring them bound to Jerusalem.

3.verse: As he traveled along, approaching Damascus, suddenly a light from heaven shone all around him;

4.verse: and falling to the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?”

5.verse: And he said, “Who are you, Lord?” And he said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

6.verse: But rise and go into the city, and it will be told you what you must do.”

7.verse: The men who were traveling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.

8.verse: So Saul got up from the ground, but although his eyes were open, he could see nothing. So they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.

9.verse: And he was three days without sight and neither ate nor drank anything.

10.verse: Now there was a disciple at Damascus named Ananias; and the Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.” And he replied, “Here I am, Lord.”

11.verse: Then the Lord told him, “Get up and go to the street called ‘Straight,’ and inquire at the house of Judas for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for even now he is praying,

12.verse: and in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him so that he might regain his sight.”

13.verse: But Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much harm he did to your saints at Jerusalem.

14.verse: And here he has authority from the chief priests to imprison all who call on your name.”

15.verse: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for this man is for me a chosen instrument to carry my name before both Gentiles and kings and the sons of Israel,

16.verse: for I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name.”

17.verse: So Ananias went and entered the house; he placed his hands on Saul and said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road by which you came, has sent me so that you may recover your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

18.verse: And immediately something like flakes fell from his eyes, and he regained his sight. Then he got up and was baptized;

19.verse: and taking food, he was strengthened. And he was with the disciples in Damascus for several days.

20.verse: And right away he began proclaiming Jesus in the synagogues, that this man is the Son of God.

21.verse: And all who heard him were astonished and said, “Is not this the man who in Jerusalem was trying to destroy those who called on this name? And has he not come here for the very purpose of bringing them bound before the chief priests?”

22.verse: But Saul became more and more capable, and threw into confusion the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that this man Jesus is the Christ.

23.verse: Now after some days had passed, the Jews plotted together to kill him,

24.verse: but their plot was made known to Saul. They kept close watch on the gates day and night so that they might kill him;

25.verse: but his disciples took him by night and let him down through an opening in the wall, lowering him in a basket.

26.verse: When he came to Jerusalem, he attempted to join the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

27.verse: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and he related to them how on the road he had seen the Lord, and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had spoken out boldly in the name of Jesus.

28.verse: And he was with them, going in and out at Jerusalem, speaking out boldly in the name of the Lord.

29.verse: He was talking and disputing with the Greek-speaking Jews, but they were looking for a way to kill him.

30.verse: And when the brothers learned about this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

31.verse: So the church throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace; being built up, and walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it increased in number.

32.verse: Now as Peter was traveling through the entire region, he also came down to the saints who were living in Lydda.

33.verse: And he found there a man named Aeneas, bedridden for eight years, who was paralyzed.

34.verse: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and make your own bed!” And immediately he got up.

35.verse: And all who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

36.verse: Now in Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha, which when translated means Dorcas. She was full of good works and acts of charity, which she was always doing.

37.verse: In those days she became ill and died; and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.

38.verse: Since Lydda is near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him urging him, “Do not delay in coming to us.”

39.verse: So Peter got up and went with them; and when he arrived, they took him to the upper room. All the widows stood beside him, weeping and showing the tunics and other clothing Dorcas used to make while she was still with them.

40.verse: But Peter put them all outside, and falling to his knees he prayed; then turning toward the dead body, he said, “Tabitha, get up!” And she opened her eyes, and seeing Peter, she sat up.

41.verse: And he gave her his hand and raised her up; then he called the saints and widows and presented her alive.

42.verse: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed on the Lord.

43.verse: And he stayed a number of days in Joppa with a certain Simon, a tanner.

1.verse: There was a man in Caesarea named Cornelius, a centurion from the cohort that was called the Italian,

2.verse: a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, gave alms generously to the people, and prayed to God continually.

3.verse: He saw in a vision clearly, about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming to him and saying to him, “Cornelius.”

4.verse: Staring at him and becoming afraid, he said, “What is it, Lord?” And he said to him, “Your prayers and your acts of charity have gone up as a memorial before God.

5.verse: And now send men to Joppa and send for a man named Simon who is called Peter.

6.verse: He is lodging with a man named Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea.”

7.verse: When the angel who spoke to him had gone away, he called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among those who waited on him,

8.verse: and when he had related everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.

9.verse: The following day, as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray about the sixth hour.

10.verse: And he became hungry and wanted to eat, but while they were preparing it, he fell into a trance,

11.verse: and he saw the heavens opened and a certain object descending, like a great sheet, being let down by its four corners upon the earth.

12.verse: In it were all kinds of four-footed animals, and reptiles of the earth, and birds of the air.

13.verse: Then a voice came to him, “Get up, Peter; slaughter and eat!”

14.verse: But Peter said, “By no means, Lord; for I have never eaten anything common or unclean.”

15.verse: And a voice came again, a second time, to him, “What God has made clean, you must not consider common.”

16.verse: This happened three times, and immediately the object was taken up to heaven.

17.verse: Now while Peter was perplexed within himself as to what the vision that he had seen might mean, behold, the men sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for the house of Simon, stood at the gate

18.verse: and called out to ask whether Simon who was called Peter was staying there.

19.verse: As Peter was thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.

20.verse: But get up, go down, and accompany them without hesitation, because I have sent them.”

21.verse: And Peter went down to the men and said, “Behold, I am the one you are looking for. What is the reason for which you have come?”

22.verse: And they said, “Cornelius, a centurion, an upright man and one who fears God, who is well spoken of by the whole nation of the Jews, was directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and to hear words from you.”

23.verse: So he invited them in and gave them lodging. On the next day he got up and set out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa went with him.

24.verse: And on the following day they entered Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.

25.verse: When Peter entered, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet and worshiped him.

26.verse: But Peter made him get up, saying, “Stand up; I myself am also just a man.”

27.verse: And as he talked with him, he went inside and found many people gathered.

28.verse: And he said to them, “You yourselves know how unlawful it is for a man who is a Jew to associate with or to visit anyone of another race, but God showed me that I should call no person common or unclean.

29.verse: Therefore, when I was summoned, I came without raising any objection. So I ask for what reason did you send for me?”

30.verse: And Cornelius said, “Four days ago at this hour, I was praying at the ninth hour in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing

31.verse: and he said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your acts of charity have been remembered before God.

32.verse: Send therefore to Joppa and invite Simon who is called Peter. He is staying in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea.’

33.verse: So immediately I sent for you, and you did well by coming. Now therefore we are all here in the presence of God to hear all that has been commanded you by the Lord.”

34.verse: So Peter opened his mouth and said: “Truly I understand that God is not one who shows partiality;

35.verse: but in every nation anyone who fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him

36.verse: As for the word that he sent to the sons of Israel, preaching good news of peace through Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all),

37.verse: you yourselves know the account that spread throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism that John proclaimed,

38.verse: Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power; who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, because God was with him.

39.verse: And we are witnesses of all that he did both in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem, whom also they put to death by hanging him on a tree.

40.verse: This man God raised up on the third day and allowed him to be seen,

41.verse: not to all the people but to witnesses who had been previously chosen by God, to us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

42.verse: And he commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God to be judge of the living and the dead.

43.verse: To him all the prophets bear witness, that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”

44.verse: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit came on all those who were listening to the message.

45.verse: And the believers, from among the circumcised, who came with Peter, were amazed that even on the Gentiles was the gift of the Holy Spirit poured out.

46.verse: For they were hearing them speaking with tongues and magnifying God. Then Peter declared,

47.verse: “Surely no one is able to withhold the water so that these people cannot be baptized who received the Holy Spirit just as we did, can he?

48.verse: And he ordered them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to remain for some days.

1.verse: Now the apostles and the brothers who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles too had accepted the word of God.

2.verse: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, they who were of the circumcision took issue with him,

3.verse: saying, “You went to a house of uncircumcised men and ate with them.”

4.verse: But Peter began and explained to them in an orderly fashion, saying,

5.verse: “I was in the city of Joppa, praying, and in a trance I saw a vision, an object descending, like a great sheet being let down by its four corners from heaven, and it came close to me.

6.verse: I looked into it closely and I saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the air.

7.verse: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter; slaughter and eat!’

8.verse: But I said, ‘By no means, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever entered into my mouth.’

9.verse: But the voice replied a second time from heaven, ‘What God has made clean, you must not consider common.’

10.verse: This happened three times, and again everything was drawn up into heaven.

11.verse: And behold, at that very moment three men arrived at the house, in which we were, sent from Caesarea to me.

12.verse: And the Spirit told me to go with them without hesitating. And with me went also these six brothers, and we went into the house of the man.

13.verse: And he told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter,

14.verse: who will speak words to you by which you and your entire household will be saved.’

15.verse: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them just as he did upon us at the beginning.

16.verse: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John indeed baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’

17.verse: If then God gave the same gift to them as he gave to us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to be able to stand in God’s way?”

18.verse: When they heard these things, they fell silent, and they glorified God, saying, “So then even to the Gentiles God has granted repentance that leads to life.”

19.verse: Now those who were scattered because of the persecution, which came to pass over Stephen, made their way as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews only.

20.verse: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who on coming to Antioch began to speak also to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.

21.verse: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number became believers and turned to the Lord.

22.verse: The report of all this was heard in the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch.

23.verse: When he came and saw the grace of God, he was glad, and he began to exhort them all to remain faithful to the Lord in the purpose of their hearts,

24.verse: for he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a considerable number of people were brought to the Lord.

25.verse: So Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,

26.verse: and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a considerable number of people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians.

27.verse: During these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

28.verse: And one of them stood up, named Agabus, and indicated by the Spirit that there would be a great famine over all the world (which took place in the days of Claudius).

29.verse: So each of the disciples, according to his financial ability, resolved to send relief to the brothers living in Judea,

30.verse: and they did so, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

1.verse: About that time Herod the king set his hand to mistreat some belonging to the church.

2.verse: He had James the brother of John put to death with the sword,

3.verse: and when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also. This was during the days of Unleavened Bread.

4.verse: When he had seized him, he put him in prison, handing him over to four squads of four soldiers each to guard him, intending after the Passover to bring him out to the people.

5.verse: So Peter was kept in prison, but prayer was made earnestly to God for him by the church.

6.verse: Now when Herod was about to bring him out, on that very night, Peter was asleep between two soldiers, bound with two chains; and guards before the door were guarding the prison.

7.verse: And behold, an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared, and a light shone in the cell. He struck the side of Peter and woke him, saying, “Get up quickly.” And his chains fell off his hands.

8.verse: And the angel said to him, “Dress yourself and put on your sandals.” And he did so. And he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around yourself and follow me.”

9.verse: And he went out and followed him, and he did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.

10.verse: When they had passed the first guard and the second, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which of its own accord opened for them, and they went out and went down one street, and immediately the angel left him.

11.verse: When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting.”

12.verse: When he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose other name was Mark, where there were many gathered together and praying.

13.verse: And when he knocked at the door of the gateway, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer.

14.verse: When she recognized Peter’s voice, because of her joy she did not open the gate, but ran back inside and reported that Peter was standing at the gate.

15.verse: They said to her, “You are out of your mind.” But she insisted that it was so. They kept saying, “It is his angel!”

16.verse: But Peter continued knocking; and when they opened, they saw him and were astonished.

17.verse: But Peter motioned to them with his hand to be silent, and he related how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Tell these things to James and to the brothers.” Then he departed and went to another place.

18.verse: Now when day came, there was no little commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.

19.verse: And after Herod searched for him and could not find him, he examined the guards and ordered them to be executed. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.

20.verse: Now Herod was very angry with the Tyrinians and the Sidonians, and with one accord they came to him and when they had persuaded Blastus, who was in charge of the bed-chamber of the king, they asked for peace because their country’s food-supply was provided by the king’s country.

21.verse: On an appointed day Herod put on his royal robes, sat down on the judgment seat, and delivered an oration to them.

22.verse: But the crowd began to shout, “It is the voice of a god, and not of a man!”

23.verse: And immediately an angel of the Lord struck Herod down because he did not give the glory to God, and he was eaten by worms and died.

24.verse: But the word of God continued to advance and gain adherents.

25.verse: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem having completed their mission, taking with them John, whose other name was Mark.

1.verse: Now there were in Antioch in the local church prophets and teachers, both Barnabas and Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius the Cyrenian, and Manaen, the foster-brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

2.verse: While they were performing their service to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”

3.verse: Then after fasting and praying they laid their hands on them and sent them off.

4.verse: So they, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.

5.verse: And when they arrived in Salamis, they began to proclaim the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews, and they also had John as their assistant.

6.verse: When they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they met a certain man, a magician, a Jewish false prophet named Bar-Jesus,

7.verse: who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul and wanted to hear the word of God.

8.verse: But Elymas the magician (for that is the way his name is translated) opposed them, trying to turn the proconsul away from the faith.

9.verse: But Saul, who is also Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him

10.verse: and said, “O man full of all kinds of deceit and all fraud, son of the devil, enemy of all righteousness, will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord?

11.verse: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a time.” And immediately fell upon him mist and darkness, and as he went about he sought someone to lead him by the hand.

12.verse: Then the proconsul believed, when he saw what had occurred, for he was astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

13.verse: Then Paul and those with him put out to sea from Paphos and came to Perga of Pamphylia. John, however, left them and returned to Jerusalem;

14.verse: but they went on from Perga and arrived at Pisidian Antioch. On the sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.

15.verse: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent a message to them, saying, “My brothers, if there is any among you with a word of encouragement for the people, say it.”

16.verse: So Paul stood up, and gesturing with his hand, said, “Men of Israel and you who fear God, listen:

17.verse: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people great during their stay in the land of Egypt; then with uplifted arm he led them out of it.

18.verse: And for about forty years he put up with their ways in the wilderness.

19.verse: After he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land as an inheritance.

20.verse: All this took about four hundred fifty years. After this he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

21.verse: Then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul, son of Kish, a man from the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled forty years.

22.verse: After removing him, he raised up David to be their king, of whom he said by way of testimony: ‘I have found in David the son of Jesse a man after my heart, who will do everything I want him to.’

23.verse: It was from the offspring of this man that God according to promise brought to Israel a savior, Jesus.

24.verse: Before his coming John had proclaimed a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

25.verse: And as John was completing his ministry, he said repeatedly, ‘What do you suppose me to be? I am not he. But behold, one is coming after me of whom I am not worthy to untie the sandals for his feet.’

26.verse: “My brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, it is to us that the message of this salvation has been sent.

27.verse: For those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers, because they did not recognize him nor understand the utterances of the prophets, which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.

28.verse: And though they found no crime deserving death, they asked Pilate to have him executed.

29.verse: And when they had carried out everything that was written about him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a tomb.

30.verse: But God raised him from the dead,

31.verse: and he was seen for many days by those who had gone up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses to the people.

32.verse: And we are telling you the good news regarding the promise that was made to the fathers,

33.verse: that God has fulfilled this for us, their children, by raising Jesus; as also in the second Psalm it is written, ‘You are my Son; today I have begotten you.’

34.verse: But regarding the fact that he has raised Jesus from the dead, no more about to return to corruption, thus he said: ‘I will give to you the sacred and sure promises made to David.’

35.verse: So also in another psalm he says, ‘You will not let your Holy One see corruption.’

36.verse: For David, after he had served the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw corruption,

37.verse: but he whom God raised up did not see corruption.

38.verse: Therefore let it be known to you, my brothers, that through this one forgiveness of sins is being proclaimed to you; and from all from which you could not be set free by the law of Moses,

39.verse: by this man everyone who believes is set free.

40.verse: Take care then that what was spoken in the prophets does not happen to you.

41.verse: ‘Look, you scoffers; be amazed and perish! For I am doing a work in your days, a work that you will not believe, even though someone should tell you in detail.’”

42.verse: As they went out, the people begged that these things be discussed with them on the next Sabbath.

43.verse: And after the meeting of the synagogue broke up, many Jews and devout converts followed Paul and Barnabas, who, as they spoke with them, were persuading them to continue in the grace of God.

44.verse: On the following Sabbath almost the whole city assembled together to hear the word of the Lord.

45.verse: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy; and blaspheming, they began to contradict what was being said by Paul.

46.verse: Both Paul and Barnabas spoke boldly and said, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken first to you. Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we are now turning to the Gentiles.

47.verse: For thus the Lord has commanded us: ‘I have appointed you to be a light for the Gentiles, to bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”

48.verse: When the Gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord, and as many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

49.verse: So the word of the Lord was being spread throughout the whole region.

50.verse: But the Jews incited the devout women of honorable rank and the leading men of the city, and they stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out of their district.

51.verse: So they shook off the dust from their feet against them and went on to Iconium.

52.verse: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

1.verse: It came to pass in Iconium that Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the synagogue of the Jews and spoke in such a way that a large group of both Jews and Greeks believed.

2.verse: But the Jews who did not believe stirred up and embittered the minds of the Gentiles against their brothers.

3.verse: So they stayed there for a considerable time, speaking out boldly about the Lord, who witnessed to the message of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done through their hands.

4.verse: But the people of the city were divided; while some sided with the Jews, others sided with the apostles.

5.verse: When there was an attempt by both Gentiles and Jews along with their rulers, to mistreat them and to stone them,

6.verse: they became aware of it and fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and to the surrounding region,

7.verse: and there they were preaching the good news.

8.verse: Now there was a man sitting in Lystra, whose feet were useless, lame from the womb of his mother, who had never walked.

9.verse: This man listened to Paul speaking. Looking intently at him, Paul saw that he had faith to be healed,

10.verse: and said in a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And he jumped up and began to walk.

11.verse: And the crowds, seeing what Paul had done, lifted up their voices, saying in the dialect of Lycaonia, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”

12.verse: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.

13.verse: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was at the entrance to the city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, intending to offer sacrifice along with the crowds.

14.verse: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of it, they tore their clothes, rushed out into the crowd, and shouted,

15.verse: saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? For we too are men subject to the same frailties as you, bringing you good news to turn away from these vain things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them,

16.verse: who in past generations allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways;

17.verse: yet he did not leave himself without witness, for he did good, giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.”

18.verse: Even saying these things, they barely restrained the crowds from offering sacrifice to them.

19.verse: But there came Jews from Antioch and Iconium, and having persuaded the crowd they stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, thinking him to be dead.

20.verse: But when the disciples gathered around him, he got up and went into the city; and on the following day he set off with Barnabas for Derbe.

21.verse: After they had preached the good news in that city and made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, then on to Iconium and to Antioch,

22.verse: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying, “It is through many tribulations that we must enter the kingdom of God.”

23.verse: And when they had appointed elders for them in every church, praying with fasting, they committed them to the Lord in whom they had believed.

24.verse: And going through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

25.verse: And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia,

26.verse: and from there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work that they had fulfilled.

27.verse: And when they arrived, and had gathered the church together, they reported all that God had done with them and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.

28.verse: And they spent no little time there with the disciples.

1.verse: Now some men came down from Judea and began to teach the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”

2.verse: And when Paul and Barnabas had no small argument and debate with them, the brethren appointed Paul and Barnabas and some others among them to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders regarding this issue.

3.verse: So being sent on their way by the church, they went through both Phoenicia and Samaria, narrating in detail the conversion of the Gentiles, and brought great joy to all the brothers.

4.verse: And when they arrived in Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and the elders, and they reported all that God had done with them.

5.verse: But some arose from the party of the Pharisees, believers, and said, “It is necessary to circumcise them and order them to keep the law of Moses.”

6.verse: The apostles and the elders were gathered to see about this matter.

7.verse: After there had been much debate, Peter stood up and said to them, “My brothers, you know that in days of old God made a choice among you, that through my mouth the Gentiles should hear the message of the gospel and believe.

8.verse: And God, who knows the heart, confirmed this, by giving the Holy Spirit to them just as he did to us,

9.verse: and he made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.

10.verse: So now why are you testing God by putting a yoke on the neck of the disciples, which neither our ancestors nor we have been able to bear?

11.verse: But through the grace of the Lord Jesus we believe that we will be saved, in the same way as those also.”

12.verse: And the entire assembly fell silent, and listened to Barnabas and Paul recounting all the signs and wonders that God had done through them among the Gentiles.

13.verse: When they finished speaking, James replied, saying, “My brothers, listen to me.

14.verse: Simeon has recounted how God first concerned himself about taking from among the Gentiles a people for his name.

15.verse: And with this agree the words of the prophets, as it is written,

16.verse: ‘After this I will return, and I will rebuild the tent of David, which has fallen, and I will rebuild the ruins of it, and I will restore it,

17.verse: so that the rest of men may seek the Lord, namely, all the Gentiles on whom my name has been called, says the Lord, who makes these things

18.verse: known from long ago.’

19.verse: Therefore I conclude that we should not trouble those from the Gentiles who are turning to God,

20.verse: but should write to them to abstain from the pollutions of idols, and from sexual immorality, and from what has been strangled, and from blood.

21.verse: For from ancient generations Moses has had in every city those who proclaim him, because he is read aloud in the synagogues every Sabbath.”

22.verse: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, together with the whole church, to send men chosen from among them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas—Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, leading men among the brothers—

23.verse: writing by their hand, “From the apostles and elders, your brothers, to the Gentile brothers in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, Greetings!

24.verse: Since we have heard that some from among us have gone out and troubled you with their words, unsettling your minds—we had given them no such instructions—

25.verse: it seemed good to us, having reached agreement, to select men to send to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

26.verse: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

27.verse: Therefore we have sent Judas and Silas, and they will tell you the same things verbally.

28.verse: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to impose on you no further burden than these essential requirements:

29.verse: that you abstain from meat sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from doing these things, you will do well. Farewell.”

30.verse: So they were sent off and went down to Antioch, and gathering the entire group together, they delivered the letter.

31.verse: And when they read it aloud, the people rejoiced at its encouragement.

32.verse: Both Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged and strengthened the brothers with a long speech.

33.verse: And when they had spent some time there, they were despatched with a greeting of peace from the brothers to those who had sent them.

34.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

35.verse: But Paul and Barnabas continued on in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

36.verse: And after some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us return indeed and visit the brothers in every city in which we announced the word of the Lord to see how they are.”

37.verse: Now Barnabas wanted to take with them John who is called Mark.

38.verse: But Paul did not think it wise to take with them this one who had withdrawn from them in Pamphylia and had not gone with them to the work.

39.verse: There arose a sharp disagreement, so that they parted from one another. Barnabas took Mark and sailed off to Cyprus,

40.verse: but Paul chose Silas and departed, having been commended to the grace of the Lord by the brothers.

41.verse: And he traveled through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.

1.verse: Paul went also to Derbe and to Lystra; and there was a certain disciple there named Timothy, the son of a converted Jewish woman, whose father was a Greek.

2.verse: He was well attested by the brothers at Lystra and Iconium.

3.verse: Paul wanted Timothy to accompany him, so he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places; for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

4.verse: As they went through the cities, they delivered to them for observance the decrees that had been decided on by the apostles and elders who were in Jerusalem.

5.verse: So the churches were strengthened in the faith, and they increased in number daily.

6.verse: And they went through the Phrygian and Galatian region, having been prevented by the Holy Spirit from speaking the message in Asia.

7.verse: And when they came to Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them,

8.verse: so they passed through Mysia and went down to Troas.

9.verse: And a vision in the night appeared to Paul: a man of Macedonia was standing there, urging him and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us!”

10.verse: And when Paul had seen the vision, immediately we tried to go into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.

11.verse: So, setting sail from Troas, we sailed on a direct course to Samothrace, and on the following day to Neapolis,

12.verse: and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of that district of Macedonia, a Roman colony. We remained in that city for several days.

13.verse: And on the Sabbath day we went outside the gate to the riverside, where we thought there would be a place of prayer, and we sat down and spoke to the women who had gathered there.

14.verse: And a certain woman, named Lydia, a seller of purple cloths from the city of Thyatira, a worshipper of God, listened; and the Lord opened her heart to respond to what was said by Paul.

15.verse: And when she was baptized, and her household as well, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and stay.” And she prevailed upon us.

16.verse: Now as we were going to the place of prayer, a slave girl who had a spirit of divination, met us. She brought great profit to her masters by fortune-telling.

17.verse: She followed after Paul and us, crying out, saying, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to you the way of salvation.”

18.verse: And this she kept doing for many days. But Paul became annoyed, and turning to the spirit, said, “I charge you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her.” And it came out that very hour.

19.verse: When her owners saw that their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers.

20.verse: And when they had brought them to the magistrates, they said, “These men are Jews, and they are disturbing our city

21.verse: by advocating customs that are not lawful for us to accept or practice, since we are Romans.

22.verse: The crowd joined in attacking them, and the magistrates tore the clothes off them and gave orders to beat them with rods.

23.verse: And when they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, charging the jailer to keep them securely,

24.verse: who, having received such a charge, put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.

25.verse: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.

26.verse: Suddenly there was a violent earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s chains were unfastened.

27.verse: When the jailer woke up and saw the doors of the prison standing open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, for he thought the prisoners had escaped.

28.verse: But Paul called out in a loud voice, saying, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here.”

29.verse: Then, calling for lights, the jailer rushed in and trembling with fear he fell down before Paul and Silas.

30.verse: Then he brought them outside and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

31.verse: And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

32.verse: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him, along with all who were in his house.

33.verse: And taking them in that hour of the night, he washed their wounds; then he was baptized at once, he and all his family.
